title: 112_hr1466
content: The Covenant to Establish a Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands in Political Union with the United States of America is amended to include a special provision for long-term residents of the commonwealth, allowing certain aliens to be admitted as immigrants with permanent resident status. The Covenant is amended to allow certain aliens in the Commonwealth to have permanent resident status until they cease to reside there permanently or their status is adjusted to that of a lawful permanent resident. The Covenant is amended to allow certain aliens in the Commonwealth to have permanent resident status until they cease to reside there permanently or their status is adjusted to that of a lawful permanent resident. The Secretary of Homeland Security shall establish a process for such aliens to apply for CNMI-only permanent resident status during a specified 90-day period. The Secretary of Homeland Security has the authority to waive certain regulatory requirements for implementing actions related to aliens described in the Covenant amendment. Compliance with specific laws may be waived if it hinders the prompt implementation of the amendment. The Secretary of Homeland Security can waive regulatory requirements for aliens meeting specific criteria under the Covenant amendment, including being born in the Northern Mariana Islands between 1974 and 1978 and being a permanent resident by May 8, 2008. The Covenant amendment allows the Secretary of Homeland Security to waive requirements for certain aliens in the Northern Mariana Islands, including spouses or children of eligible aliens and immediate relatives of US citizens as of May 8, 2008. The Covenant amendment allows the Secretary of Homeland Security to waive requirements for certain aliens in the Northern Mariana Islands, including spouses or children of eligible aliens and immediate relatives of US citizens as of May 8, 2008. An alien may apply for an immigrant visa or adjust their status to that of a permanent resident between January 1, 2015, and January 1, 2016. The Secretary of State will reduce the total number of diversity immigrant visas upon granting an immigrant visa or approval of an application for permanent residence to an alien. Fees apply to applications for CNMI-only permanent resident status or adjusting status to that of an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence. The Secretary of State and the Secretary of Homeland Security have the discretion to reduce fees for CNMI-only permanent resident status, immigrant visas, or adjustment of status for aliens lawfully admitted for permanent residence. They may also waive the affidavit of support requirement in certain cases. They may also waive the affidavit of support requirement in certain cases, as outlined in U.S.C. 1183a) and subparagraphs (B)(ii) and (C)(ii) of section 212(a)(4) of such Act (8 U.S.C. 1182(a)(4)).
